sen.j: 西笑承兌（さいしょうじょうたい、天文 (元号)17年（1548年） - 慶長12年12月27日 (旧暦)（1608年2月13日））は豊臣政権～江戸時代に活躍した臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Saishojotai (December 27, 1548-February 13, 1608) was a Rinzai Sect monk who was active from the Toyotomi regime to Edo period.
Saisho Jotai (December 27, 1548-February 13, 1608) was a Rinzai Sect monk who was active from the time of the Toyotomi regime to the Edo period.
sen.cmt: Split name into 2Added "the time of the" and "the"
sen.e: Saisho Jotai (1548 - March 23, 1608) was a Rinzai Sect monk who was active from the time of the Toyotomi regime to the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 日付訂正スペース補足グレゴリオ暦に変更

sen.j: 相国寺承兌とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He is also called Shokoku-ji Jotai.
He was also called Shokoku-ji Jotai.
He was also called Shokoku-ji Jotai.

sen.j: 伏見（京都市伏見区）の人。
sen.e: He is originally from Fushimi (present Fushimi-ku, Kyoto City).
He was originally from Fushimi (present-day Fushimi-ku, Kyoto City).
He was originally from Fushimi (present-day Fushimi-ku, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉や徳川家康の知恵袋の一人として知られ、特に諸法度や外交文書の起草、学問奨励策や寺社行政の立案や、法要などの仏事の運営に重要な役割を果たした。
sen.e: He is known as one of the brains of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who played an important role in drafting various laws (shohatto) and diplomatic documents, planning learning incentive programs and administration of temples and shrines, and conducting Buddhist rites such as Buddhist memorial service.

He is known as one of the intellects of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's governments, playing an important role in drafting "shohatto" laws and diplomatic documents, planning education promotion and temple administration, and conducting Buddhist rites such as Buddhist memorial services.
sen.cmt: "brains"→"intellects"Added "'s governments""who played"→"playing"Moved "shohatto"Changed brackets to inverted commas"learning incentive programs"→"education promotion""administration of temples and shrines"→"temple administration"Made "service" plural
sen.e: He is known as one of the intellects of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's governments, playing an important role in drafting Shohatto laws and diplomatic documents, planning education promotion and temple administration, and conducting Buddhist rites such as Buddhist memorial services.
sen.cmt: 原文に『』がないので" "を削除、S大文字

sen.j: 幼い時に出家し、はじめ一山派の仁如集堯（1483年 - 1574年）らに参禅して学んでいたが、天正12年(1584年)に荒廃していた相国寺に住するようになり、中華承舜の嗣法となって夢窓派に転じ、相国寺を再建、翌年には鹿苑僧録となった。
sen.e: He became a priest at young age and practiced Zen meditation under Ninjo Shugyo (1483-1574) in Issanha at first, but in 1584, he started to liven in devastated Shokoku-ji Temple, then converted to Mushoha by becoming a successor to Chuka Shoshun and rebuilt Shokoku-ji Temple, next year, he assumed a position of Rokuon soroku.
sen.cmt: 広辞苑によると「嗣法」は（師から弟子へと正しい教えを受け継ぐこと）とあるため、「嗣法になる」という日本語そのものが間違っている可能性があります。そのためここでは「（教えの）継承者」という意味で、"successor"という訳語を用いました。
sen.e: He became a priest at a young age and at first practiced Zen meditation under Ninjo Shugyo (1483-1574) of the Issanha sect, but in 1584, he started to live in the ruined Shokoku-ji Temple, then converted to the Musoha sect by becoming a disciple of Chuka Shoshun, rebuilt Shokoku-ji Temple and, the following year, he became the Rokuon Soroku, in charge of choosing head priests of Zen temples.
sen.cmt: Added "a"Moved "at first""in"→"of the"Removed 'n' from "liven""devastated"→"the ruined""Mushoha"→"the Musoha sect""successor to"→"disciple of" - I think "disciple" makes more sense here ", next "→"and, the following""assumed a position of"→"became the"Added brief explanation of "Rokuon Soroku"
sen.e: He became a priest at a young age and at first practiced Zen meditation under Ninjo Shugyo (1483 - 1574) of the Issanha sect, but in 1584, he started to live in the ruined Shokoku-ji Temple, then converted to the Musoha sect by becoming a disciple of Chuka Shoshun, rebuilt Shokoku-ji Temple and, the following year, he became the Rokuon Soroku, in charge of choosing head priests of Zen temples.

sen.j: その後南禅寺に入ったが、後、再度、鹿苑僧録となり、豊臣秀吉の政治顧問となる。
sen.e: After that, he entered Nanzen-ji Temple and became a Rokuon soroku again, then a political advisor of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
After that, he entered Nanzen-ji Temple but later became the Rokuon Soroku again as well as a political advisor to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: "that, he entered""and became a" →"but later became the"", then" →"as well as""of" →"to"
sen.e: After that, he entered Nanzen-ji Temple but later became the Rokuon Soroku again as well as a political advisor to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 豊臣秀次や豊臣秀頼とも親交を持った。
sen.e: He formed a friendship with Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI and Hideyori TOYOTOMI.
He was also close to Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI and Hideyori TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: "formed a friendship with"→"was also close to"
sen.e: He was also close to Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI and Hideyori TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: また、伏見版『周易』（1605年）の出版を行なったため、近世易学の隆盛の祖ともされている。
sen.e: Also, he published "Shueki" (Fushimi print, 1605), thus he is called a founder of the prosperity of modern art of divination.
sen.cmt: 「伏見版」については下記サイトを参考にし、"Fushimi print"のみを訳語としました。http://www.ndl.go.jp/exhibit/50/html/catalog/c041.html
sen.e: He also published "Shueki" (Fushimi print, 1605), and is thus seen as the originator of the popularity of the modern art of divination.

sen.e: He also published "Shueki" (Fushimi print, 1605), and is thus seen as the originator of the popularity of the modern art of divination.
